image.altText: A saltwater crocodile floats on a still body of water.

props.synopsis: Fishing guide Sean Fiumara says he was on a boat with clients when a saltwater crocodile launched at him "out of nowhere" and latched onto his leg, "instantly pulling [him] into and under the water".

title.children: 'I could see him latched onto my leg': Fisher narrowly escapes croc attack on boat

image.altText: A large four-metre crocodile sits on the sand bank.

props.synopsis: An online influencer has come under fire for boasting about feeding a four-metre crocodile in Far North Queensland just a month after penalties for interfering with the reptiles were drastically increased.

title.children: Influencer under investigation over wild croc feeding video

image.altText: Aunty Tapua hopes the funding will resolve the water security issues, for the sake of the future of the community.

props.synopsis: The First Nations community of Cherbourg will receive $26 million to upgrade its water infrastructure, after years of substandard supply despite living just three hours' drive from Brisbane.

title.children: Community forced to buy in bottled water hopes new funds will finally fix town's E. coli-riddled supply

image.altText: A photo of Mike Reynolds sitting in a black suit and looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: In the days after WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention, the government sacked its corrective services commissioner, Mike Reynolds. Now, for the first time, he details the chaos behind the scenes during his tenure.

title.children: Sacked corrective services boss lifts lid on troubled youth detention system

image.altText: People in traditional Indonesian clothes

props.synopsis: Adelaide students have enjoyed a flamboyant exchange program with their sister school near Jakarta for the first time since the 2002 Bali bombings put the program on hold.

title.children: School renews Indonesian cultural exchange 22 years after Bali bombings put it on hold

image.altText: NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk sitting in chair being interviewed for TV.

props.synopsis: In an interview with Stateline, NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk says the NT government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 12 to 10 will only entrench cycles of disadvantage and increase the number of violent adult criminals in the territory's justice system.

title.children: NT children's commissioner says lowering criminal age will increase violent offending

image.altText: Supercars

props.synopsis: Ipswich and Tailem Bend return to the Supercars schedule for 2025 as the historic Sandown race moves to the penultimate round in November.

title.children: Two circuits return for the 2025 Supercars schedule as Sandown moved to later in the year

image.altText: A girl looking at her phone

props.synopsis: Young people say racist commentary on social media makes them feel unsafe, as a report calls for a systemic overhaul to address the rampant racism experienced by young Territorians.

title.children: Cruel vitriol on Alice Springs social media pages leaves young people feeling frightened and vulnerable

image.altText: 2024-10-03T220058Z_772970726_RC29DAALVLAQ_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-LEBANON

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he has discussed possible Israeli strikes on Iranian oil facilities, with his comments causing a spike in oil prices.

title.children: Senior Hezbollah figure targeted in Beirut strikes as stoush over Iranian ambassador breaks out in Australia

image.altText: Dental xray illuminated on a light screen.

props.synopsis: A new report shows many Australians are delaying dentist visits or waiting years to receive publicly funded care — and in some parts of the country, wait times are going up.

title.children: Thousands of Australians are hospitalised for potentially preventable dental conditions, report shows

image.altText: Two dingoes walking through the wide open cage

props.synopsis: The Shire of Murchison says it's "unlikely" two popular pet dingoes on farmstay Wooleen Station were shot under its bounty system.

title.children: Council defends dingo bounty after disappearance of two 'pets' helping station's conservation effort

props.synopsis: Ahmad Sadeghi made remarks on social media late last month, the day Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike.

title.children: Peter Dutton calls for Iranian ambassador to be expelled after tweet praising slain Hezbollah leader

image.altText: A close up photo of a woman wearing a police uniform

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police have brought in a former human rights commissioner to conduct an official review of the culture within the force following an ABC News investigation.

title.children: Commissioner 'horrified' by bullying and sexism claims within NSW Police as official review launched

image.altText: Australia's Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The NACC confirms it conducted a raid on the premises at Parliament House, saying its investigation does not relate to a current or former politician.

title.children: Corruption watchdog conducts raid at Parliament House in relation to 'ongoing investigation'

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: Tech graphic

props.synopsis: Ever received a scam text from Australia Post while you're waiting for a package? Or a fake toll notice after you've driven on a toll road? Experts say data collected by the online advertising industry could be behind it.

title.children: The completely legal trick scammers can exploit to target millions of Australians

image.altText: Police officers stand at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Two men have been shot by police in Wentworthville after allegedly driving a stolen vehicle at NSW Police officers.

title.children: Two men shot by police in Sydney's west after allegedly driving stolen car at officers

image.altText: Donald Trump does a fist pump.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump likely won't face court again before next month's election but that doesn't mean the wheels aren't still turning on the criminal cases against him.

title.children: Donald Trump and Mike Pence's partnership didn't end well. New court filings allege just how bad it got

image.altText: A balcony overlooking water.

props.synopsis: Queensland authorities are probing the fees residents are charged to sell retirement villas, following an ABC investigation into the multi-billion-dollar sector.

title.children: State government to probe retirement village provider's close ties to real estate company

image.altText: Blonde woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Psychologist Frances Crawford, 49, was found dead at the bottom of a retaining wall at her property west of Brisbane in the early hours of July 30.

title.children: Police appeal for information about the marriage of ride-on mower murder victim

image.altText: A series of photos of someone in a kitchen, taken from ground level

props.synopsis: Without even entering the building, we were able to silently peer through the camera on a Deebot device made by Chinese giant Ecovacs.

title.children: The world's largest home robotics company has a problem – its vacuum cleaners can be hacked from afar

props.synopsis: X (formerly Twitter) has unsuccessfully challenged Australia's eSafety Commissioner's fine for allegedly failing to respond to questions about harmful content on its platform, particularly child sexual abuse material.

title.children: X Corp loses court challenge to avoid fine over child abuse notice

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Oil prices have surged amid fears of a broadening conflict in the Middle East, with the Australian share market trading lower. See how the day unfolded on the markets blog.

title.children: Crude oil prices jump amid fears of Israeli strike on Iranian oil facilities, ASX closes lower — as it happened

image.altText: Military personnel dressed in blue march holding Australian flags

props.synopsis: This year's Lowy Institute Asia Power Index ranks Australia as the fifth most influential player in the continent, but its strength may not have grown all that much.

title.children: Australia is now a more 'powerful' nation than Russia. Here's how it ranks in eight key areas

image.altText: aerial photo of island with blue water and clouds at the top

props.synopsis: After years of negotiations, the UK is giving up its sovereignty over a cluster of strategically important Indian Ocean islands. The move has led to criticism from Britain's Conservative opposition and some local Indigenous groups.

title.children: This tiny island chain has been under British control since 1814. That changed this week

image.altText: A rendering of PsiQuantum's Brisbane quantum computer

props.synopsis: Australia is making a billion-dollar bet on a "useful" quantum computer in the Queensland capital, but surprisingly few experts agree on what the nation will get in return for its investment.

title.children: Australia is bankrolling a $1b quantum computer in Brisbane. Big corporations will use it first

image.altText: An empty construction site

props.synopsis: The demise of Quasar Constructions has left an estimated $60 million debt and disrupted critical projects including the Western Sydney International Airport, with subcontractors calling on the federal government to protect the struggling construction industry.

title.children: Collapse of high-profile construction company leaves debt and disruption for major projects

image.altText: Man with glasses and wearing a flannelette shirt

props.synopsis: An inquest into death of a man from septic shock at Bunbury Hospital highlights miscommunication and significant backlogs the state's struggling regional health system.

title.children: Coroner flags multiple 'missed opportunities' in WA man's country hospital death

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt standing next to a woman with her face blurred.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old man has died on a front lawn in Melbourne's north-west, after allegedly being stabbed by his stepson.

title.children: Melbourne man killed in alleged stabbing 'always looked out' for family

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands at a diplomatic event

props.synopsis: A Cambodian woman working as a maid in Malaysia has been deported to her homeland and subsequently arrested over comments she posted on social media criticising Cambodian government leaders.

title.children: Maid deported by Malaysia to Cambodia for criticising Cambodian leaders

image.altText: Image of a coal mine from above with what appears to be activity

props.synopsis: A coal mining group with former links to a US fraudster denies claims of illegal mining, and destroying koala habitat without federal approval. Environment groups are doubling down, and want immediate action.

title.children: 'This is illegal coal mining': Koala habitat cleared without federal approval by company previously linked to fraudster

image.altText: Dentist with a patient in a dental chair.

props.synopsis: Unable to chew food properly, Daniel withdrew $67,000 from superannuation to fix his teeth. But he didn't realise that tax rules would drain an additional $19,000 from his retirement savings.

title.children: To fix his teeth Daniel had to raid his super — but there was a very big catch

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: It's often cheaper to buy private label or "home brand" groceries. But they're also often more profitable for the supermarkets.

title.children: Home brand products are cheaper at the supermarket. But are they good value?

image.altText: Erik Menendez (R) and brother Lyle listen to court proceedings during a May 17, 1991 appearance.

props.synopsis: New evidence has emerged that corroborates allegations that Erik Menendez was sexually abused by his father and he and his brother Lyle killed their parents in self-defence.

title.children: Prosecutors to review new evidence in Menendez brothers' 1996 murder conviction

image.altText: Woman with white hair, black top and ivory blazer looks ahead

props.synopsis: Jurors found Tina Peters guilty in August for allowing a man to misuse a security card to access to the Mesa County election system and for being deceptive about that person's identity.

title.children: Former US state county clerk jailed for 9 years for 2020 presidential race voting data scheme
